data.meanings: Negative particle giving to the present the sense of the perfect; not.
data.sentence: The word لَمْ comes from the root ل م and is associated with the meanings: Negative particle giving to the present the sense of the perfect; not.
The word مِنَ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".
data.sentence: The word شَيْئًا comes from the root ش ي ا and is associated with the meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word يَكُنْ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
The word هَلْ comes from the root ه ل and is associated with the meanings: is it ... ?

data.meanings: to come, to bring, come to pass, come upon, do, commit, arrive, pursue, put forth, show, increase, produce, pay, reach, happen, overtake, draw near, go, hit, meet, join, be engaged or occupied, perpetrate (e.g. crime), undertake
data.sentence: The word أَتَى comes from the root ا ت ي and is associated with the meanings: to come, to bring, come to pass, come upon, do, commit, arrive, pursue, put forth, show, increase, produce, pay, reach, happen, overtake, draw near, go, hit, meet, join, be engaged or occupied, perpetrate (e.g. crime), undertake

data.meanings: to be or become sociable, companionable, conversable, inclined to company or conversation, friendly, amicable, or familiar. To be or become cheered, or gladdened or cheerful, gay, or gladsome. To be or become at ease, or tranquil; without shrinking or aversion.
data.sentence: The word الْإِنْسَانِ comes from the root ا ن س and is associated with the meanings: to be or become sociable, companionable, conversable, inclined to company or conversation, friendly, amicable, or familiar. To be or become cheered, or gladdened or cheerful, gay, or gladsome. To be or become at ease, or tranquil; without shrinking or aversion.

data.meanings: (Ha-Alif-Nun) To arrive, come, be at hand (time, season), be fit, be reaped.
data.sentence: The word حِينٌ comes from the root ح ي ن and is associated with the meanings: (Ha-Alif-Nun) To arrive, come, be at hand (time, season), be fit, be reaped.

data.meanings: To happen. Dahrun, plu. Duhur: Time (short or long); Beginning of time; Year; Event; Time from the beginning of the world to its end; Epoch; Vicissitudes of time; Calamity; Fate; as time brings to pass events; Good or evil.
data.sentence: The word الدَّهْرِ comes from the root د ه ر and is associated with the meanings: To happen. Dahrun, plu. Duhur: Time (short or long); Beginning of time; Year; Event; Time from the beginning of the world to its end; Epoch; Vicissitudes of time; Calamity; Fate; as time brings to pass events; Good or evil.

data.meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
data.sentence: The word مَذْكُورًا comes from the root ذ ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
